content.content:
[]>narrator:This is not the first...
[]>torturer{torturer-emotion|neutral}:You damn wench. WHERE IS THE SEED?
[]>narrator:...And probably not the last... <ap> interrogation.
[]>narrator:Another kick lands square in your face.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|tortured2}:You drip more crimson on the floor.
[]>torturer:You bitch.
[]>narrator:He grabs your hair and throws you to the ground.
[]>torturer:We'll get our answers sooner or later.
[]>narrator:It seems your raspy gurgling still does not comprise a sufficient answer.
[]>narrator: And you don't intend for that to change any time soon.<lc>The painful echoes of months past would be for nothing if you caved in now, or ever.
[]>one:Hhhh....
[]>narrator:Heaving dryly, your form remains a motionless puddle on the untreated concrete floor. <mp>The rough texture has made short work of the skin on your knees, as has been its modus operandi for many interrogations now.<lc>The dried blood seeped into it has been the only form of organic hospitality you've ever known here.

[]>narrator: Within seconds of this lack of physical abuse, you find yourself lost in the bloodied blottings on the floor. <mp>A few breaths later, the pointed boot of your assailant makes its way back into your field of view. <lc>The clericant towers over you, like a panoptic guard tower. <mp>With a glance at his wrist-mounted timekeeper, he nudges the boot's steel tip against your stomach and draws out todayâ€™s concluding words from behind the mask...

[]>torturer: ...Sooner or later...
[]>narrator: ...And leaves you to vegetate in a pool of your own blood.

[]>narrator:It has been an arduous trek out here. The dry summer heat has been taking its toll on your mental faculties, as has the absolute pain of using public transit out to a correctional facility beyond the city walls. <lc>Yet, it will all be worth it... <ap>today. <ap>Some time. <mp> One was supposed to be released before noon. <ap>The sun is well past its zenith now.
[]>narrator:It has been many months since you last saw her. Standing in the empty and wide-open driveway of the prison complex, you could only seek shelter from the burning sun overhead by the graces of one companion: <ap> A solitary tree that is still groaning under the weight of its death here.<lc> The field surrounding the concrete walls is parched and mostly dead during summer. <mp>Weeds donning the colors of ash and pottery adorn the endless expanse of earth here.<lc>Only the call of cicadas disturbs the air around you. <ap>Consistently so. <mp>These insects have been your only fellowship for hours now.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:Ugh this shit SUCKS!
[]>narrator:You kick a rock into the arid landscape. <ap>The soil answers by dust cloud.
[]>anhedonia:...<lc>Fuck me.
[]>narrator:For the nth time now, you walk up to the gate- <ap>or the fireline rather.
[]>narrator:The guard shoots you another annoyed look, and you glare back in kind.
[]>narrator:And so you pan around to face your dead arboreal companion, and stride towards it again.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>narrator:Bending down to your backpack, you feel your face sag from the dust that has started to cake up your skin in combination with your sweat.
[]>anhedonia:Come on...
[]>narrator:You are on your last bottle. But the release ought be soon, so you take another gulp from the silicone vessel.<lc>You sit down against the tree, dried bark scraping against your skin. <lc>As the afternoon stretches out, the silence is eventually broken.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:Immediately, a bolt runs up your spine, visions of One's brains splattered across the concrete walls on the other side. <ap>When the echo has fled into the distance, the cicadas' song returns to dominate the soundscape. <lc>More bullets follow in the form of your nervous sweat, as minutes stretch into anxiety-filled hours- <ap>Or at least feel as such.
[]>narrator:Looking forward towards the guard, he unimpressedly inspects your still form, then returns to scanning the landscape in its entirety again.<lc>The pain of uncertainty is enough to drive you mad, the crusted sand on your face now becoming an improvised fidget toy.
[]>anhedonia:I'm so gonna fucking lose it...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying}:One... please...
[]>narrator:Silently sobbing, small droplets washing your cheeks, you spend your time like this. <lc> And then, finally, after what might as well have been a trip to hell and back, the main gate opens,<ap> and One stands there, duffel bag in hand, stature as broken as ever.<lc>You leave your backpack behind, run up to her, and just as she can react and drop her own bag, you're in each other's arms once again.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible,one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye0}:I missed you.
[]>narrator:Immediately your heart accelerates and a sorely-missed warmth wells up inside your core, up, up into your chest. You inhale her scent. <ap>You hold One even tighter, as if she would vanish if you let go again. <mp>She squeezes back. <lc>You nuzzle against her nose and she drives forward to entrap you in a sea-deep kiss. <lc>You pull away, and you find yourself lost in each other's eyes. This is happiness once more.
[]>one:I missed you too.
[]>narrator:You squeeze her tight. <mp>She squeezes back. <lc>You stay like this for a few seconds, until the guard barks a stern dismissal at you.
[]>anhedonia:Guard's a bitch...
[]>one:Let's just go.
[]>anhedonia:Yea...
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral,one+anhedonia-emotion|invisible}:And so, you make you way to what has transformed into your makeshift encampment for the day.
[]>anhedonia:May I carry your bag?
[]>one:It's fine.

[]>anhedonia:C'mon, you literally just got out of prison. Lemme treat you a bit.
[]>one:...<ap>fine.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:You take her bag from her hands, careful to brush her hand, giving her a gleeful smile.
[]>one:You are such a cheesy motherfucker.
[]>anhedonia:Hehe... Can't help it after being reunited with my wife.
[]>narrator:you give her a kiss.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Hehe...
[]>narrator:You quickly nuzzle against her, and then shoulder your own gear.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:So like- <ap> I don't wanna rush but the busses out here run like ass, so let's try and get back to the bus stop for now?
[]>one:Yeah, no worries.
[]>narrator:And so you sling One's backpack over your shoulder, and take her hand in your other one. <ap>You never take your eyes off of her. <mp>One more kiss, pulling her in. Tired but glad, One looks up at you. <mp>And then you depart.

[]>narrator:Hands never parting for even a second, you make your way back to the bus station you arrived at this morning. Under the sweltering late-summer and even-later-afternoon sun, the sweat pooling between yours and One's hand would make most girls uncomfortable, were it not for the fact that you two are - <ap>factually<ap> - gay as hell.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:So... <ap>What was that gunshot before you were released?
[]>one:You think I had something to do with that?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Well, now that you say it...
[]>one:I did.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:But don't wanna talk about it. <lc>Safe now. With you.
[]>narrator:You give her hand a reassuring scqueeze in return.
[]>anhedonia:With you.
[]>narrator:Finally, after a few minutes of walking, you reach the bus stop. <mp>Standing there in silence, you do nothing but exchange glances and small squeezes of each other's palms. <mp>A kiss- <ap>occasionally.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:Still gotta get used to... <ap> a ceiling that's not made of concrete again.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Yeah...<lc>I was gonna... like...<lc>I'm not gonna ask you how your stay was?
[]>one:Mhm.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one:But yea. <ap>Bad. <ap>You know.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:But now I'm back with you!
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:I'm really glad too.
[]>narrator:Another kiss.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Waiting for the bus the two of you make sure to hydrate with what little you have left carrying with you.
[]>narrator:After a few more minutes, your publicly-funded ride out of here finally appears.

[]>narrator:the bus ride home is barely one at all. your eyes are fixated on each other the entire time. legs pressing against each other, fingers interlocked and kisses exchanged. some perhaps too intense for public consumption. <lc> you don't care.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: it's insane how quickly the tides of emotion can sway.
[]>anhedonia: oh so eloquent.
[]>one: yiu pick up many skills to stop you from going insane in there.
[]>one:..
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:.. so yes...
[]>anhedonia: where were we?
[]>one:.. ummm..
[]>anhedonia:...tides of emotion!
[]>one: yes! <lc>...<lc> Heh... I survived, fuckers.
[]>narrator:Self-sufficiently, One mutters to herself.
[]>anhedonia:I'm happy you did.
[]>one:Mhm.
[]>narrator:She lets her gaze wander outside, across the landscape. <mp>Across this dying, decrepit, hopeless landscape.
[]>one:...
[]>narrator:you glance at the bus display overhead, crystalline gasses flickering into shape.
[]>anhedonia: should be there in 17 minutes.
[]>narrator:you press into One for another kiss, like planting a banner on this vessel of decrepit public transit: we are fucking gay.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Despite your hormonal inclinations, you do not pounce on One immediately once you enter your shared apartment. <mp>The two of you are filthy- <ap>And not in the good way.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:Ugh.
[]>narrator:Dropping your bags in the hallway, you immediately try to restrict your movement as to not carry dust everywhere. <lc>One does not share the same concerns and immediately strides into the kitchen- <ap>presumably scavenging for chilled beverages.<lc>You missed your wife.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:With a quick pit stop in your bathroom to at least clean your skin of the almost clay-like residue that formed on it outside the prison walls, you sit down next to her embryonic form in front of the open fridge door.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Cold...
[]>narrator:You already see her catching one again.
[]>anhedonia:I- uhh- got some drinks for your return. <mp>They're in the fridge...
[]>narrator:With a quiet giggle, One drags her fingers across the bits of your leg in front of her.
[]>one:Thank you...
[]>narrator:You ruffle her head.

[]>narrator:After the both of you have gotten cleaned up, and secured drinks of choice - <ap>two times water on account of the pavement melting outside -<ap> you muster the courage to ask something that started plaguing your mind right after One's sentence began.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:I know we sent many letters over this... <mp>But I need to ask you in person too.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:...
[]>anhedonia:You're not upset at me?
[]>one:You kept the shrines safe, didn't you?
[]>anhedonia:...<lc>I did.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:Then everything is the way it should be.
[]>anhedonia:Doesn't mean you can't be angry at me.
[]>one:Am not.
[]>anhedonia:...<mp>I cost you two and a half years of your life.
[]>anhedonia:I...<ap> I didn't manage to protect you from the one thing I promised to protect you from.
[]>one:...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:I wasn't killed.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|crying}:...

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye0-crying,anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible}:Choking through tears, One suddenly collapses into your chest.
[]>one:...Don't...<ap>Don't let me be killed by them.
[]>anhedonia: I... <ap>Try...
[]>one:Can you promise?
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:Please.
[]>anhedonia:... <lc>I don't want to fail again...
[]>one:Then don't.
[]>anhedonia:... I promise. <mp>No death at the hands of the state.
[]>narrator:You hold her even tighter.

[]>one:Thank you...
[]>anhedonia:Always...
[]>one:Fuck... <mp>Didn't expect a breakdown on the first day...
[]>narrator:She lets out a chuckle.
[]>one:Fucking dramatic faggots.
[]>anhedonia:Heh...

[]>narrator:You spend the next few minutes caressing her form, assuring her that you are there- will be there- for her. <lc>One keeps breathing into your chest, hands clinging tightly to your top- <lc>Eventually however, you reckon to break the silence somehow. <mp>You don't want your day of reunion to end up with One crying her soul out immediately.<lc>You ponder. <mp>You wrack your brain for anything to say, your own heart still shaken by One's breakdown. <mp>By One's breakdown. <lc>One. <mp>Your wifegirlfriend. <mp>Lover... <lc>No. <mp>Not yet. <lc>You need to be an anchor more than anything right now. <ap>For her.
[]>anhedonia:I got you... <mp>I'm not going anywhere.
[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye0}:One doesn't respond but you take that as a positive sign.
[]>narrator:And so, you keep standing there, One in your arms, waiting for the world to disrupt this beautiful trance.
[]>one:...<mp> Can we cuddle?

[]>narrator: Many more hours pass by, and eventually with the golden rays of the evening sun entering the window, you find yourself situated underneath One as your blanket. Together in your bed again, you simply have been holding her close, showering her frail form in gentle kisses. 
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty, one-emotion|listening}:So... I've been wondering... <mp>Are our cycles still synced up?
[]>one: What kinda question! <mp>... <mp>Sad into horny is still real, isn't it?
[]>narrator:You give an affirmative grunt.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:I think I'm about to have my period? I still haven't started bothering to track it.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Then we're definitely out of rhythm...<lc>...
[]>one: why?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: because I'm starting to ovulate and being so close to you is... making it difficult to thing of much else....
[]>one:Even after...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:Yea... sorry.
[]>one:It's fine. <lc>I'm not feeling it.. Not yet.
[]>anhedonia:That's fine.
[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Intense emotions, huh...
[]>anhedonia:Yea.
[]>narrator{one-emotion|sad}:One nuzzles against your chest in affection, then looks up at you with eyes at the brink of tears.<lc>It is like this, where she exhaustedly opens a request.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:Say... The air is getting thick and we have a cloudless night. Could we go up to the hill?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Gladly.
[]>narrator:And so, with the sky dark overhead, you take a walk outside, enjoying One's first day of freedom together.

2.page_key: A Bus ride home from prison

content.content: []>narrator:The walk to the foot of the hill takes you out beyond the reaches of the urban developments, yet still within the city walls. <mp>It is here where light pollution starts to recede towards its cocoon of electro-chemical origins.

[]>one:I'm glad the hill still stands.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:bweheh... You're saying that as if the hill itself doesn't exist anymore.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Well, I don't know- <ap>Maybe someone dropped a nuke on it.
[]>anhedonia:Hehe...
[]>anhedonia:...<ap> Wait a second...
[]>narrator:You shoot her a knowing glance.
[]>narrator:She bleps her tongue back at you with a wink. <mp>Sighing wistfully, you smile back at One. <mp>You time a small sidestep so you can nudge against her as you walk.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:...<lc>Haven't been up here in so long...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Yeah...
[]>one:...<lc>The sky is so pretty.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>narrator:Gazing at the sky in silence, you continue the trek up the footpath winding itself up this pine and gravel hill.  
[]>one:Does the bench up upon the hill still exist?
[]>anhedonia:Maybe. <ap>I'd hope so. 
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}:I'd definitely have noticed if some dropped a nuke on it.
[]>one:Oh shuddup.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Hehe.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:And truth be told, the wooden seating implement has did not become the target of WMDs, or other ordnance for that matter, since you last sat here - <ap>alone - <ap>a few weeks ago. <ap>Maybe months? <mp>This became a place of mourning without One around.
[]>narrator:You sit down on the bench, thigs squished against one another, hands holding each other tightly.

[]>anhedonia:This fucking city... <ap>Are you happy to be back?
[]>narrator:One considers for a moment. Patiently like the stars shimmering brightly in the night sky, you await her answer.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:...
[]>one:Only for you.<lc>...<lc>And, <ap>well, <ap>the godseed.

[]>anhedonia: How often have you thought about this?
[]>one: Hm?
[]>anhedonia: Your first day back... Out.
[]>narrator: One's grasp on your hand weakens.
[]>one: A bit. Like how we'd even be towards each other.
[]>anhedonia: Me too...
[]>one: Worried?
[]>narrator: You restrengthen your skinship, squeeze her hand even tighter.
[]>anhedonia: Not much. I know I won't really fall out of love with you.
[]>anhedonia: It's just been a while.
[]>one: Has been.
[]>anhedonia: ...I love you.
[]>one: I love you too.
[]>narrator: You exchange many more kisses in between.
[]>anhedonia: So... You're just gonna go back to work now?
[]>one: Can't wait forever. The rest of the world doesn't hesitate to deal with us either.

content.meta.text: play_chapter_intro(one, No More Inoculants, home_regular, 1.0, consume_the_body)

content.content:
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: thank you for keeping me safe all this time. stable.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}: gladly.
[]>narrator{one-emotion|listening}: you let out an introspective sigh.
[]>one: it feels so fast to go off inoculants already
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: well it's your call.
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:..
[]>one: I just can't really wait any longer, and they do make my head a bit floaty... make the mind feel sticky.
[]>anhedonia: well...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: does it feel rushed?
[]>one: no
[]>anhedonia: then...
[]>one:... you know my souls burns for something more. <lc>This body is made to be consumed.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...Yes.
[]>one: no more inoculants.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:We will burn these fuckers to the ground.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: YES! <lc> Yes we will!

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:So how do we start?
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:I don't know yet. <lc>I think I wanna take the day off for now. Enjoy the world with you a bit.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:I'd like that.

[]>narrator: And true to your word, you did not lift a single finger yesterday. But as soon as you opened your eyes this morning, the world resumed its regular pulse. <lc>A pulse that led you here, to the edge of isolation. <mp>Watching the caustic skyline trace the barrier between earth and sky after you woke up reminded of you of where you are- <ap>where you were. <lc>You can never go back there.

[]>narrator:Aggressive, grating, synthetic beats fill the air around your work. your mouth tastes of sweet acid, traces from the treat you had mere minutes ago. small and empty capsules of isotonic liquid dot the floor around your workspace. you'll get to cleaning those... eventually.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia  walks up behind you, water jug in hand.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Stay hydrated sunshine.
[]>narrator: She refills your water glass. In teturn, you briefly shoot her a gentle smile before you turn your gaze back towards the work at hand.
[]>one{anhedonia-emotion|happy,one-emotion|neutral}: Thank you.
[]>anhedonia: Meow.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Barely back from prison and already back to work?
[]>one:Can't stay idle forever.
[]>anhedonia: Sigh... <ap> So... What are you doing right now?
[]>one: ...<lc>Sketching out a sigil.
[]>narrator: Trying to find the ideal sign to beckon and guide the suncalling has been a grueling/grinding/extensive task. it is a shape that ought to serve as beacon for the sun to visit, for just a moment.

[]>narrator:That happens
[]>one:You know I'm willing to tear myself apart over this.
[]>anhedonia:I know. I saw.
[]>one:We both did.
[]>anhedonia:We did.
[]>one:Thank you for it.<lc>We all need to shape our souls.

[]>narrator: you bolt awake to the sensation of your skin on fkre. painful blisters have begun to dot your skin, a sign of your body's transfiguration to come. The strings of time taut through the air above spell out the time: 8th gold, 1st earth. The time before time. the twilight of non-dusk. after over two years, this is almost a new sensation again. clarity marks your mind. this is the 8912th solar cycle of your life. 
[]>narrator:Anhedonia's shell lies next to you, back turned, and her soul is screaming in square waves. she has always been loud inside.
[]>narrator:fuck, this wisdom is hard to bear. and it is barely the beginning.
[]>narrator:With a searing pain trveling up your spine, arms, and torso, you lie awake. Multitudinous eternities pass, and the camera switches to a side profile of you. your own eyes are fixated towards the ceiling, staring holes into the air.

[]>narrator:Eventually, anhedonia awakes.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sleepy}: Mgnnmngm....
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: ...
[]>narrator: She turns towards you, her perlecescent eyes meeting you. A dull shimmer in this rolling-shutter-dressed room.
[]>anhedonia: Moog monnin... Good morning...
[]>narrator: Gently, softly, you climb on top of her, and with the fidelity of a silk veil, you taste her lips. <mp>Your raging soul fire calms down, becomes a mane only for you to see, and when anhedonia embraces you, holds you, you melt into her.
[]>narrator:Anhedonia places more gentle kisses along your neck and lips.
[]>narrator:Internally, you cry a river of blood. Your period is looming right on top of you. The squelching of involuntary blinks from the godeyes are wet enough to make your soul hiss.
[]>narrator:What an awful feeling. <mp>In time, as you press more and more of your form into Anhedonia and she feels you up just as intensely, a remark leaves her.

[]>anhedonia: ...One... The eyes are already showing up again.
[]>one: I think the last batch of... <ap>inoculations wore off 2 weeks before my release. This is what I'd... We'd expect.
[]>anhedonia:Didn't they ever find any traces of the seed or the antiseed?
[]>one: They don't have medical checkups down there. <lc>they don't even know what to look for.
[]>anhedonia: Cant believe we managed to hide the godseed...
[]>one: Well... They're not always the sharp masterminds they propagandize themselves to be. Maybe they noticed and didn't do anything because it didn't grow?
[]>anhedonia: I wouldn't trust their benevolence like that.
[]>one: I wouldn't trust their competence.
[]>one:...<lc>Fuck...
[]>narrator:Your eyes-<ap> the ones you entered this world with-<ap> almost fall shut again.

[]>one:Anyways, thank you.
[]>narrator:You let out a small yawn.
[]>one:Just getting those blotters to me was enough. Also helped with closing the eyes...
[]>anhedonia:You're still so sleepy.
[]>one:Possibly...

[]>narrator{one-emotion|listening}:When you wake up again not even an hour later, the drive in your veins cannot keep you down.
[]>narrator:Finding yourself in the kitchen mere minutes later, the /red Beet juice equivalent/ provides you with more base nutrients to stopgap your anemic state. It has a sweet yet biting taste, like what you imagine would be pickled and candied moss. <lc>Your own eyes directed out the kitchen window, you watch the endless streaks of clouds polluting the sky. The insects killfucking each other on the windowsill barely make a blip for your attentiveness radar.<lc>You hear footsteps approach and naturally you tense up. This is your apartment. Only Anhedonia is here. The footsteps are closer now. The floorboards creak and your nails dig into the plywood tabletop. Your heart is racing and then, it stops. With half-closed eyes, Anhedonia shows herself as muvh as her sleep deprivation. You cease tensing more. Her frame lingers in the doorway. You relax.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:Hi.
[]>one:...
[]>narrator:She puts her hands up to the horizontal fake-wood frame. Her toned arms flow beautifully into her shaven armpits. Letting your eyes wander down across her chest and core muscles, you delight in how her crop top and low rise pajamas lay bare her happy trail.
[]>anhedonia:Heh...
[]>one:Morning...
[]>narrator:You blink up.
[]>one:Didn't expect you to be up this early.

[]>one: My body just seems to not really want to stay down
[]>narrator: anhedonia takes a few seconds to rub her temlpes and takes a glance through the window behind you, the sun slowly creeping up the horizon line.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: you barely rested. it's first gold.
[]>narrator: with a shrug and an idle smile, you respond.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: it's one of the more productive eigths.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:groggily, anhedonia shuffles towards you, hands going straight for your waistband.

[]>one: hey
[]>anhedonia: what...
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: ... hm?<lc> don't want me to?
[]>narrator: pouting, you look up at her. you can feel her breath on your lips. <mp>So close.
[]>anhedonia:...<lc>cute.<lc> fine, you get your good morning kiss.
[]>narrator: quiet and breathily, you exude a gentle whimper.
[]>one: please...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: ...

[]>narrator: Upon reaching that last syllable, all of One's blood bursts skywards like a volcanic eruption. The godseed blooms and within seconds the sun has been called upon you.
